level.text: No person shall promote an event without a promoter’s license issued pursuant to this section.
An applicant for a license as a promoter shall submit the following information with the application:
If the applicant is a corporation, the names and street addresses of its directors, officers, and resident agent;

If the applicant is a partnership or joint venture, the name and street address of each partner or joint venturer, but if a partner or joint venturer is a corporation, the name and street address of each director, officer and the resident agent of the partner or joint venturer;
If the applicant is an unincorporated association, the names and street addresses or all trustees and managing directors of the applicant; and

Any information required by the Commission to determine whether the applicant or any of its principal officers have been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor involving fraud or which has a substantial relationship to the regulation of boxing.

An applicant is not eligible for a license as a promoter if the applicant has been convicted of a misdemeanor within five (5) years, or a felony within ten (10) years, preceding the date of application.
The Commission may take disciplinary action against a promoter in the case of the violation by a matchmaker of § 2011.3.
